description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS) remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38130), it is crucial to apply the relevant security updates as detailed below:

1. Identify the appropriate KB Article for your system version from the list below:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)  
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)  
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)  
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
   - For Windows 10 (various versions): [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782) or [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)

2. Download the updates from the official Microsoft Update Catalog links provided above.

3. Install the updates on your system and restart the device to ensure changes are applied.

**Details**:
- These updates are critical for addressing the heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability (CWE-122) that could allow remote code execution. By ensuring your systems are up-to-date, you mitigate the risk of exploitation.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure you are running the supported version of Windows as indicated in the KB Articles.
- Backup important data before proceeding with the update installations.
